alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 1:01PM PST until December 06 at 6:12AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... North Fork Stillaguamish River Near Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rainfall is mostly ended in the north central Cascades, but residual runoff, possibly with a small addition of lower elevation snow melt has edged the North Fork Stillaguamish River above major flood category. For the North West Region...including Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Stillaguamish River near Arlington. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, the North Fork Stillaguamish River will cause flooding in the Cicero and Swede Heaven areas...Oso Loop Road...and SR 530. Flood waters will also cause riverbank erosion. A stage of 14 feet corresponds to Phase 3 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM PST Tuesday was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting now at 15.0 ft. and is expected to soon start falling. It will fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 915 PM PST.
